markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 6"
    pfs="Limited"
>
[Lantern of Empty Light](/Equipment.aspx?ID=916)
</title>

<spoilers>May contain spoilers from Abomination Vaults</spoilers>

<traits>
<trait label="Rare" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=137" />
<trait label="Enchantment" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=61" />
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=103" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Pathfinder #163: Ruins of Gauntlight](/Sources.aspx?ID=71) pg. 78</row>

**Price** 240 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** held in 1 hand

**Bulk** 1
</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

It's said that the pale blue light of this eldritch lantern shines from another dimension or even is linked, somehow, to the glow of a ghost when it is consumed by the Outer Goddess [Nhimbaloth](/Deities.aspx?ID=163). A lantern of empty light is not intrinsically an evil item, though it remains a favored tool of those who would manipulate the minds of others for sinister reasons. It can be used as a normal [bull's-eye lantern](/Equipment.aspx?ID=29), but prolonged use tends to instill in the user a vague sense of being watched by unseen eyes.

<document level="2" id="action-694" />

<document level="2" id="action-695" />

<column gap="tiny">

</column>
name: Lantern of Empty Light
